verses.verse: Why, <WH199> Job, <WH347> I pray <WH4994> you, hear <WH8085> my speeches, <WH4405> and listen <WH238> to all <WH3605> my words. <WH1697>
Behold, <WH2009> now <WH4994> I have opened <WH6605> my mouth, <WH6310> my tongue <WH3956> has spoken <WH1696> in my mouth. <WH2441>
My words <WH561> shall be of the uprightness <WH3476> of my heart: <WH3820> and my lips <WH8193> shall utter <WH4448> knowledge <WH1847> clearly. <WH1305>
The spirit <WH7307> of God <WH410> has made <WH6213> me, and the breath <WH5397> of the Almighty <WH7706> has given me life. <WH2421>
If <WH518> you can <WH3201> answer <WH7725> me, set your words in order <WH6186> before <WH6440> me, stand <WH3320> up.
Behold, <WH2005> I am according to your wish <WH6310> in God's <WH410> stead: I also <WH1571> am formed <WH7169> out of the clay. <WH2563>
Behold, <WH2009> my terror <WH367> shall not make you afraid, <WH1204> neither <WH3808> shall my hand <WH405> be heavy <WH3513> on you.
Surely <WH389> you have spoken <WH559> in my hearing, <WH241> and I have heard <WH8085> the voice <WH6963> of your words, <WH4405> saying,
I am clean <WH2134> without <WH1097> transgression, <WH6588> I am innocent; <WH2643> neither <WH3808> is there iniquity <WH5771> in me.
Behold, <WH2005> he finds <WH4672> occasions <WH8569> against <WH5921> me, he counts <WH2803> me for his enemy, <WH341>
He puts <WH7760> my feet <WH7272> in the stocks, <WH5465> he marks <WH8104> all <WH3605> my paths. <WH734>
Behold, <WH2005> in this <WH2063> you are not just: <WH6663> I will answer <WH6030> you, that God <WH433> is greater <WH7235> than man. <WH582>
Why <WH4069> do you strive <WH7378> against <WH413> him? for he gives not account <WH6030> of any <WH3605> of his matters. <WH1697>
For God <WH410> speaks <WH1696> once, <WH259> yes twice, <WH8147> yet man perceives <WH7789> it not.
In a dream, <WH2472> in a vision <WH2384> of the night, <WH3915> when deep <WH8639> sleep falls <WH5307> on men, <WH582> in slumberings <WH8572> on the bed; <WH4904>
Then <WH227> he opens <WH1540> the ears <WH241> of men, <WH582> and seals <WH2856> their instruction, <WH4561>
That he may withdraw <WH5493> man <WH120> from his purpose, <WH4639> and hide <WH3680> pride <WH1466> from man. <WH1397>
He keeps <WH2820> back <WH2820> his soul <WH5315> from the pit, <WH7845> and his life <WH2416> from perishing <WH5674> by the sword. <WH7973>
He is chastened <WH3198> also with pain <WH4341> on his bed, <WH4904> and the multitude <WH7379> of his bones <WH6106> with strong <WH386> pain:
So that his life <WH2416> abhors <WH2092> bread, <WH3899> and his soul <WH5315> dainty <WH8378> meat. <WH3978>
His flesh <WH1320> is consumed <WH3615> away, that it cannot <WH3808> be seen; <WH7210> and his bones <WH6106> that were not seen <WH7200> stick <WH8205> out.
Yes, his soul <WH5315> draws near <WH7126> to the grave, <WH7845> and his life <WH2416> to the destroyers. <WH4191>
If <WH518> there be a messenger <WH4397> with him, an interpreter, <WH3887> one <WH259> among <WH4480> a thousand, <WH505> to show <WH5046> to man <WH120> his uprightness: <WH3476>
Then he is gracious <WH2603> to him, and said, <WH559> Deliver <WH6308> him from going <WH3381> down <WH3381> to the pit: <WH7845> I have found <WH4672> a ransom. <WH3724>
His flesh <WH1320> shall be fresher <WH7375> than a child's: <WH5290> he shall return <WH7725> to the days <WH3117> of his youth: <WH5934>

He shall pray <WH6279> to God, <WH433> and he will be favorable <WH7521> to him: and he shall see <WH7200> his face <WH6440> with joy: <WH8643> for he will render <WH7725> to man <WH582> his righteousness. <WH6666>
He looks <WH7789> on men, <WH582> and if any say, <WH559> I have sinned, <WH2398> and perverted <WH5753> that which was right, <WH3477> and it profited <WH7737> me not;
He will deliver <WH6299> his soul <WH5315> from going <WH5674> into the pit, <WH7845> and his life <WH2416> shall see <WH7200> the light. <WH216>
See, <WH2005> all <WH3605> these <WH428> things works <WH6466> God <WH410> oftentimes <WH6471> <WH7969> with man, <WH1397>
To bring <WH7725> back <WH7725> his soul <WH5315> from the pit, <WH7845> to be enlightened <WH215> with the light <WH216> of the living. <WH2416>
Mark <WH7181> well, <WH7181> O Job, <WH347> listen <WH8085> to me: hold <WH2790> your peace, <WH2790> and I will speak. <WH1696>
If <WH518> you have <WH3426> anything <WH3605> to say, <WH4405> answer <WH7725> me: speak, <WH1696> for I desire <WH2654> to justify <WH6663> you.
If <WH518> not, listen <WH8085> to me: hold <WH2790> your peace, <WH2790> and I shall teach <WH502> you wisdom. <WH2451>
